title: Dialogflow - Create and manage agents
abstract:
# Dialogflow - Create and manage agents
All agent-related menus and information are found at the top of the left sidebar menu at the Dialogflow Console. There, you'll see a list of the agents associated with your account and the option to create a new agent.
content:
## Create an agent
**Note:** You can only create one agent per [region](/dialogflow/es/docs/how/region) for a GCP project. If you need multiple agents in the same region, you will need to create multiple projects.
To create an agent with the console (common), follow these steps:
- You must have a [role with full or edit access](/dialogflow/es/docs/access-control#roles) in order to create an agent.
- Go to the [Dialogflow ES Console](https://dialogflow.cloud.google.com) .
- If requested, sign in to the Dialogflow console. See [Dialogflow console overview](/dialogflow/docs/console) for more information.
- Click **Create Agent** in the left menu. (If you already have other agents, click the agent name, scroll to the bottom and click **Create new agent** .)
- Enter your agent's name, default language, default time zone and GCP project, then click the **Create** button. (You can change the [agent edition](/dialogflow/docs/editions) after creation.)
To create an agent with the API (uncommon), see [Create an agent with the API](/dialogflow/es/docs/how/agent-create-api) .
## Delete an agent
**Caution:** Deleting an agent **cannot** be undone. [Export](/dialogflow/docs/agents-settings#export_and_import) your agent to keep a backup if necessary.
- You must have a [role with full access](/dialogflow/docs/access-control#roles) in order to delete an agent in the Dialogflow Console. **Note:** Either full or edit access can delete an agent when using the API.
- Before deleting an agent, you must remove access for all users besides yourself:- If you are the only user with the Owner/Admin role, you can [use the Dialogflow Console to remove other users](/dialogflow/docs/access-control#df-console) .
- If more than one user has the Owner/Admin role, you must [use the GCP Console to remove other users](/dialogflow/docs/access-control#gcp-console) .
- To delete an agent:- Go to the [Dialogflow ES Console](https://dialogflow.cloud.google.com) .
- Select the agent you wish to delete.
- Click on the settingsbutton next to the agent's name.
- Select the **General** tab, and scroll down to the bottom.
- Click **Delete this agent** . If you do not see the **Delete this agent** button, it is because you do not have the required Owner/Admin role.
- Enter **DELETE** in the text field.
- Click **Delete** .If you [delete your project](/resource-manager/docs/creating-managing-projects#shutting_down_projects) , all Dialogflow ES agents and data associated with the project are deleted within 60 days of project deletion. If you receive an error when attempting to delete a project due to an existing lien, see the troubleshooting documentation [section on project liens](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/support/troubleshooting?agent=any&category=any#project-lien) .
